lines_and_colors: A train went through a burial gate,
A bird broke forth and sang,
And trilled, and quivered, and shook his throat
And then adjusted his little notes,
Doubtless, he thought it meet of him
To say good bye to men.
document.title: A train went through a burial gate
document.publication: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998
